perturbation.original_text: By this Agreement the Members enter into a joint venture (the "Venture") in accordance with the laws of the State of Florida. The rights and obligations of the Members will be as stated in the applicable legislation of the State of Florida (the "Act") except as otherwise provided here.
perturbation.changed_text: By this Agreement the Members enter into a general partnership (the "Venture"). The rights and obligations of the Members will be subject to the Members' discretion, notwithstanding any conflicting legislation of the State of Florida (the "Act").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'joint venture' is replaced with 'general partnership,' but the agreement then contradicts established partnership law by stating that member rights are at their discretion, effectively negating the statutory framework for partnerships in Florida. This creates uncertainty about which laws govern the venture.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Partnership Law, Chapter 620, Florida Statutes

perturbation.original_text: Capital Contributions may be amended from time to time, according to the requirements of the Venture, by decision of the Members as recommended by the Managers. Where Members' interests are affected, additional capital contributions (the "Additional Capital Contributions") must have the unanimous consent of the Members.
perturbation.changed_text: Capital Contributions may be unilaterally demanded by any Manager at any time, according to the immediate needs as perceived by that single Manager. Where Members' interests are affected, additional capital contributions (the "Additional Capital Contributions") will be determined by a simple majority vote of the Managers.
perturbation.explanation: This change fundamentally alters the procedure for Additional Capital Contributions. The original text requires unanimous consent when member interests are affected, which is consistent with protecting member investments. The modified text allows a single manager to unilaterally demand contributions and changes the approval process to a simple majority, which directly contradicts basic principles of partnership/venture law, which grants partners rights regarding capital contributions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Partnership Law, specifically regarding rights of partners to control capital contributions and protect their investment.

perturbation.original_text: In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the fair market value appraisal of all Venture assets (less liabilities) in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) by an independent accounting firm agreed to by all Members. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members.
perturbation.changed_text: In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be arbitrarily determined by the remaining Members with no requirement for an appraisal or adherence to accounting principles. There is no requirement to appoint an appraiser. The valuation will be non-negotiable and immediately binding on all Members.
perturbation.explanation: This modification replaces the fair market value appraisal requirement with an arbitrary valuation by the remaining members, removing the requirement of an independent appraisal following GAAP. This directly contradicts the principles of fair valuation in business law, specifically regarding partner/member rights during dissolution or withdrawal. It removes any objective standard for valuation, allowing the remaining members to potentially undervalue the departing member's share.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of Fair Valuation in Business Law, fiduciary duties of partners/members.
